intro: Oliganthes discolor, commonly known as the variable dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and consist of both ray and disk florets, typical of the family. Oliganthes discolor is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed habitats.
